title: Graph Description - Sentence Completion
content:
Select the option or options which can complete the sentence. Select ALL the possible answers.

NB: There are no graphs or charts for this exercise.

questions.instructions: Select ALL the options which can complete the sentence correctly.
questions.question: The graph illustrates…

mc_options.text: A. …the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment declined.
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. After 'illustrates', you need either a noun phrase (option C) or 'that' + clause (option B). You cannot use a clause without 'that' after 'illustrates'.

mc_options.text: B. …that the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment declined.
mc_options.feedback: Correct! 'Illustrates that' + clause is grammatically correct. The conjunction 'that' introduces the subordinate clause.

mc_options.text: C. …the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment.
mc_options.feedback: Correct! 'Illustrates' can be followed by a noun phrase. Here, 'the typical number of years...' is a noun phrase describing what the graph shows.

questions.no_answer_feedback: You did not select any answers. The correct answers are B and C.

questions.instructions: Select the option which can complete the sentence correctly.
questions.question: It is clear from the graph…

mc_options.text: A. …the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment declined.
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. 'It is clear from the graph' requires 'that' + clause. You need option B with the conjunction 'that'.

mc_options.text: B. …that the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment declined.
mc_options.feedback: Correct! 'It is clear from the graph that' + clause is the only grammatically correct completion. The conjunction 'that' is required after 'it is clear'.

mc_options.text: C. …the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment.
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. After 'it is clear from the graph', you must use 'that' + a complete clause (option B), not just a noun phrase.

questions.no_answer_feedback: You did not select an answer. The correct answer is B.

questions.instructions: Select ALL the options which can complete the sentence correctly.
questions.question: The graph shows…

mc_options.text: A. …the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment declined.
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. After 'shows', you can use either 'that' + clause (option B) or a noun phrase (option C), but not a bare clause without 'that'.

mc_options.text: B. …that the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment declined.
mc_options.feedback: Correct! 'Shows that' + clause is grammatically correct. The verb 'shows' can take a 'that'-clause as its object.

mc_options.text: C. …the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment.
mc_options.feedback: Correct! 'Shows' can be followed by a noun phrase. Here, the noun phrase describes what the graph displays.

questions.no_answer_feedback: You did not select any answers. The correct answers are B and C.

questions.instructions: Select the option which can complete the sentence correctly.
questions.question: As is shown by the graph,…

mc_options.text: A. …the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment declined.
mc_options.feedback: Correct! 'As is shown by the graph' is a subordinate clause, so the main clause can follow directly without 'that'. This structure uses the passive voice effectively.

mc_options.text: B. …that the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment declined.
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. After 'as is shown by the graph,' you don't need 'that'. The comma indicates the subordinate clause is complete, and the main clause should follow directly (option A).

mc_options.text: C. …the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment.
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. This is an incomplete sentence. After 'as is shown by the graph,', you need a complete main clause with a verb (option A shows the decline).

questions.no_answer_feedback: You did not select an answer. The correct answer is A.

questions.instructions: Select the option which can complete the sentence correctly.
questions.question: From the graph it is clear…

mc_options.text: A. …the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment declined.
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. After 'it is clear', you must use 'that' + clause. Option B is correct with the conjunction 'that'.

mc_options.text: B. …that the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment declined.
mc_options.feedback: Correct! 'It is clear that' + clause is the only grammatically correct structure. The conjunction 'that' is required after the predicate adjective 'clear'.

mc_options.text: C. …the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment.
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. After 'it is clear', you need 'that' + a complete clause (option B), not a noun phrase without 'that'.

questions.no_answer_feedback: You did not select an answer. The correct answer is B.

questions.instructions: Select the option which can complete the sentence correctly.
questions.question: As is illustrated by the graph,…

mc_options.text: A. …the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment declined.
mc_options.feedback: Correct! 'As is illustrated by the graph' is a subordinate clause, so the main clause follows directly without 'that'. The comma signals the transition from the subordinate to the main clause.

mc_options.text: B. …that the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment declined.
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. After 'as is illustrated by the graph,', you don't need 'that'. The subordinate clause is complete, and the main clause should follow directly (option A).

mc_options.text: C. …the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment.
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. This is incomplete. After the introductory subordinate clause, you need a complete main clause with a finite verb showing what happened (option A includes 'declined').

questions.no_answer_feedback: You did not select an answer. The correct answer is A.

questions.instructions: Select the option which can complete the sentence correctly.
questions.question: As the graph shows,…

mc_options.text: A. …the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment declined.
mc_options.feedback: Correct! 'As the graph shows' is a subordinate clause, so the main clause can follow directly. No conjunction is needed after the comma.

mc_options.text: B. …that the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment declined.
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. After 'as the graph shows,', you don't use 'that'. The subordinate clause is complete, and the main clause should follow directly (option A).

mc_options.text: C. …the typical number of years people in the UK stayed in one position of employment.
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. This is an incomplete sentence. You need a complete main clause with a finite verb (option A includes 'declined') after the introductory subordinate clause.

questions.no_answer_feedback: You did not select an answer. The correct answer is A.
